January 9, 1933
SPECIAL BULLETIN
First zone: DANIEL E. NOBLE, WCAC
DDNNEDTIDUT AGRICULTURAL COLLEGE
Stdrrs, Connecticut
Second Zone: G. R. Faint, WJBU
Lewisburg, Pennsylvania
third Zone: GARLAND POWELL, WRUF
UNIVERSITY OF FLORIDA
Gainesville, Florida
Fourth Zone: H. G. INGHAM, KFKU
FIFTH ZONE: H. V. CARPENTER, KWSC
STATE COLLEGE OF WASHINGTON
AT LARGE: R. C. HIGGY, WEAO
Columbus, Ohio
TO MEMBERS
of
THE ASSOCIATION OF COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITY BROADCASTING STATIONS
(and educational officials cooperating with the Association)
Attached you will find a communication addressed to your executive sec¬
retary by Mr* Joe F. Wright, University of Illinois, President of the
Association, dealing with a very important letter from Dr, Tracy Tyler,
Secretary, National Committee on Education by Radio, Washington, D. C.
Again the Association is confronted by a problem which strikes at edu¬
cational broadcasting throughout the United States. It behooves each
and every station official to immediately contact his senators and
representatives so that we may impress upon Congress the fact that taxes
of this sort on state-owned stations are not justifiable. In writing
will you kindly send carbon copies of your letters to Senators Couzens
and Dill, and likewise supply this office with a copy of your communica¬
tion so that we may complete our files,
THIS IS AN IMPORTANT ISSUE. IN THE INTEREST OP EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTING
IT BEHOOVES YOU TO ATTEND TO THIS MATTER IMMEDIATELY UPON RECEIPT OF THIS
SPECIAL BULLETIN. MAY WE EXPECT A ONE HUNDRED PER CENT RESPONSE.
Sinperely yours,
CM 77).
T, M. Beaird, Executive Secretary
